textPlain: it was just a matter of time before the reward/error/etc. would become a vector instead of a scalar - whether it is a vector of tokens or a vector of some other qualities the  output is evaluated for. So, instead of vector gradient - d scalar error by d every var - we'll have a matrix and thus would be matrix-transforming the NN instead of just adding the gradient.
No implementation details, no samples from an actual reward model in action, no github repo. Looks like a sales page more than anything. Eww.
